mk.tmdb.core
Class TMDbAPI

java.lang.Object
  mk.tmdb.core.TMDbAPI

public final class TMDbAPI
extends java.lang.Object

Static class that offers methods for calling the The Movie Database Api.

Author:
Mirko Polato

getConfiguration

public static ResponseObject getConfiguration()
Gets the system wide configuration information. Some elements of the API require some knowledge of this configuration data. This method currently holds the data relevant to building image URLs as well as the change key map. To build an image URL, you will need 3 pieces of data. The base_url, size and file_path. Simply combine them all and you will have a fully qualified URL.

Returns:
The TMDb API response object.

getAuthenticationToken

public static ResponseObject getAuthenticationToken()
This method is used to generate a valid request token for user based authentication. A request token is required in order to request a session id. You can generate any number of request tokens but they will expire after 60 minutes. As soon as a valid session id has been created the token will be destroyed.

Returns:
The TMDb API response object.

getAuthenticationSession

public static ResponseObject getAuthenticationSession(Token token)
This method is used to generate a session id for user based authentication. A session id is required in order to use any of the write methods.

Parameters:
token - The authentication token
Returns:
The TMDb API response object

getAuthenticationGuestSession

public static ResponseObject getAuthenticationGuestSession()
This method is used to generate a guest session id. A guest session can be used to rate movies without having a registered TMDb user account. You should only generate a single guest session per user (or device) as you will be able to attach the ratings to a TMDb user account in the future. There is also IP limits in place so you should always make sure it's the end user doing the guest session actions. If a guest session is not used for the first time within 24 hours, it will be automatically discarded.

Returns:
The TMDb API response object

getAccountInformation

public static ResponseObject getAccountInformation(java.lang.String sessionID)
Gets the basic information for an account.

Parameters:
sessionID - The session ID
Returns:
The TMSB API response object

getMovieChanges

public static ResponseObject getMovieChanges(int movieID)
Get the changes for a specific movie id. Changes are grouped by key, and ordered by date in descending order. By default, only the last 24 hours of changes are returned. The maximum number of days that can be returned in a single request is 14. The language is present on fields that are translatable.

Parameters:
movieID - The movie ID
Returns:
The TMDb API response object

getMovieChanges

public static ResponseObject getMovieChanges(int movieID,
                                             java.util.Date start,
                                             java.util.Date end)
Get the changes for a specific movie id. Changes are grouped by key, and ordered by date in descending order. By default, only the last 24 hours of changes are returned. The maximum number of days that can be returned in a single request is 14. The language is present on fields that are translatable.

Parameters:
movieID - The movie ID
start - The date where the search starts
end - The date where the search ends
Returns:
The TMDb API response object

                                             java.lang.String end)

The maximum number of days that can be returned in a single request is 14. The language is present on fields that are translatable.

getUpcomingMovies

public static ResponseArray getUpcomingMovies()
Gets the list of upcoming movies. This list refreshes every day. The maximum number of items this list will include is 100. Returns the results of the first page.

Returns:
The TMDb API response array

getUpcomingMovies

public static ResponseArray getUpcomingMovies(int page)
Gets the list of upcoming movies. This list refreshes every day. The maximum number of items this list will include is 100. Returns the results of the given page number.

Parameters:
page - The page number to retrieve
Returns:
The TMDb API response array

getAllUpcomingMovies

public static ResponseArray getAllUpcomingMovies()
Gets the entire list of upcoming movies. This list refreshes every day. The maximum number of items this list will include is 100.

Returns:
The TMDb API response array

getInTheatresMovies

public static ResponseArray getInTheatresMovies()
Gets the list of movies playing in theatres. This list refreshes every day. The maximum number of items this list will include is 100. Returns the results of the first page.

Returns:
The TMDb API response array

getInTheatresMovies

public static ResponseArray getInTheatresMovies(int page)
Gets the list of movies playing in theatres. This list refreshes every day. The maximum number of items this list will include is 100. Returns the results of the given page number.

Parameters:
page - The page number to retrieve
Returns:
The TMDb API response array

getAllInTheatresMovies

public static ResponseArray getAllInTheatresMovies()
Gets the entire list of movies playing in theatres. This list refreshes every day. The maximum number of items this list will include is 100.

Returns:
The TMDb API response array

public static ResponseArray getPopularMovies()
Gets the list of popular movies on The Movie Database. This list refreshes every day. Returns the results of the first page.

Returns:
The TMDb API response array

getTopRatedMovies

public static ResponseArray getTopRatedMovies()
Gets the list of top rated movies. By default, this list will only include movies that have 10 or more votes. This list refreshes every day. Returns the results of the first page.

Returns:
The TMDb API response array

getTopRatedMovies

public static ResponseArray getTopRatedMovies(int page)
Gets the list of top rated movies. By default, this list will only include movies that have 10 or more votes. This list refreshes every day. Returns the results of the given page number.

Parameters:
page - The page number to retrieve
Returns:
The TMDb API response array

getAllTopRatedMovies

public static ResponseArray getAllTopRatedMovies()
Gets the list of all top rated movies. By default, this list will only include movies that have 10 or more votes. This list refreshes every day.

Returns:
The TMDb API response array

setMovieRate

public static ResponseObject setMovieRate(java.lang.String sessionID,
                                          boolean guest,
                                          int movieID,
                                          float rating)
This method lets users rate a movie.

Parameters:
sessionID - The session ID
guest - Whether the session is a guest session
movieID - The movie ID
rating - The rating of the movie
Returns:
The TMDb API response object

getPersonChanges

public static ResponseObject getPersonChanges(int personID)
Gets the changes for a specific person id. Changes are grouped by key, and ordered by date in descending order. By default, only the last 24 hours of changes are returned. The maximum number of days that can be returned in a single request is 14. The language is present on fields that are translatable.

Parameters:
personID - The person ID
Returns:
The TMDb API response object

getPersonChanges

public static ResponseObject getPersonChanges(int personID,
                                              java.util.Date start,
                                              java.util.Date end)
Gets the changes for a specific person id. Changes are grouped by key, and ordered by date in descending order. By default, only the last 24 hours of changes are returned. The maximum number of days that can be returned in a single request is 14. The language is present on fields that are translatable.

Parameters:
personID - The person ID
start - The date where the search starts
end - The date where the search ends
Returns:
The TMDb API response object

getPersonChanges

public static ResponseObject getPersonChanges(int personID,
                                              java.lang.String start,
                                              java.lang.String end)

The TMDb API response object

getCollectionInformation

public static ResponseObject getCollectionInformation(int collectionID)
Gets the basic collection information for a specific collection id. You can get the ID needed for this method by making a /movie/{id} request and paying attention to the belongs_to_collection hash. Movie parts are not sorted in any particular order. If you would like to sort them yourself you can use the provided release_date.

Parameters:
collectionID - The collection ID
Returns:
The TMDb API response object

getCollectionImages

public static ResponseObject getCollectionImages(int collectionID)
Gets all of the images for a particular collection by collection id.

Parameters:
collectionID - The collection ID
Returns:
The TMDb API response object

getChangedMovies

public static ResponseArray getChangedMovies()
Gets a list of movie ids that have been edited. By default we show the last 24 hours and only 100 items per page. The maximum number of days that can be returned in a single request is 14. You can then use the getMovieChanges method to get the actual data that has been changed. Please note that the change log system to support this was changed on October 5, 2012 and will only show movies that have been edited since. Returns the results of the first page.

Returns:
The TMDb API response array

getChangedPersons

public static ResponseArray getChangedPersons()
Gets a list of people ids that have been edited. By default we show the last 24 hours and only 100 items per page. The maximum number of days that can be returned in a single request is 14. You can then use the getPersonChanges method to get the actual data that has been changed. Please note that the change log system to support this was changed on October 5, 2012 and will only show people that have been edited since. Returns the results of the first page.

Returns:
The TMDb API response array
